title: 111_hr899
content: The Act is titled the "Ethical and Legal Elections for Congressional Transitions Act" and requires a special election in case of a vacancy in the office of a Senator. Special Election: If the President of the Senate certifies a vacancy in a Senator's office, the state's chief executive must hold a special election within 90 days. The election must follow state laws. The subsection requires special elections for Senate vacancies to comply with state laws. An exception is made for vacancies near a regularly scheduled election, where the President of the Senate can issue a certification within specific timeframes. The subsection requires special elections for Senate vacancies to comply with state laws, with an exception for vacancies near a regularly scheduled election. The President of the Senate can issue a certification within specific timeframes. Nothing in this section affects a state's authority to authorize temporary appointments to fill a vacancy until a special election is held. SEC. 297 of the Help America Vote Act of 2002 provides payments to states to reimburse a portion of the costs incurred in holding special elections to fill Senate vacancies. The Commission will make payments to eligible States to cover costs incurred in holding special elections to fill Senate vacancies. States must submit a statement of costs to receive payment. The Commission will make payments to eligible States to cover 50 percent of the reasonable costs incurred in holding special elections to fill Senate vacancies. States must submit a statement of costs to receive payment, including information on primary election costs and any other required assurances. The Commission will make payments to States for 50% of the costs incurred in holding special elections to fill Senate vacancies. States must submit a cost statement, and payments will be made within 30 days. States must agree to repay any excess payment over actual election costs. Authorization of appropriations for payments under this part for fiscal year 2009 and beyond. Addition of a new section for payments to reimburse costs of holding special elections to fill Senate vacancies. Sec. 297 authorizes payments to States to reimburse costs for holding special elections to fill Senate vacancies, with Sec. 297A authorizing appropriations.
